input.name: matomoUrl
input.label: Matomo URL
input.help-text: URL to the Matomo service. E.g. http://localhost or //example-site.matomo.cloud

input.name: matomoJavaScriptUrl
input.label: Matomo JavaScript URL
input.help-text: Base URL to the Matomo JavaScript. E.g. http://localhost or //cdn.matomo.cloud/example-site.matomo.cloud

input.name: cacheOverride
input.label: Cache override
input.help-text: Leave empty to not affect cache. Add new date to override cache, and remove it after a week. Not critical to remove it, but will keep it cleaner.

input.name: siteId
input.label: Site ID
input.help-text: Site ID for the site. E.g. 1 or 2

input.name: domainName
input.label: Site domain name
input.help-text: Base domain name for the site, e.g example.com

input.name: insertDomainName
input.label: Insert domain name in front of page title.
input.help-text: If a user visits the «About us»-page on blog.example.com, it will appear as «blog / About us». This is the easiest way to get an overview of your traffic by subdomain.

input.name: hideAliasClicks
input.label: In the "Outlinks" report, hide clicks to known alias URLs of this site.
input.help-text: So clicks on links to Alias URLs (eg. x.example.com) will not be counted as "Outlink".

input.name: disableCookies
input.label: Disable tracking cookies
input.help-text: Matomo can track users without tracking cookies too, but may lose precision for some reports. Note: If the Cookie Panel app is used on this site, it will override this setting.

item-set.name: matomoTagManager
item-set.label: Matomo Tag Manager
item-set.help-text: Enable Matomo Tag Manager. Note: This will disable the default pageView event, so you must set this up in Matomo Tag Manager to track page views.

input.name: containerId
input.label: Tag Manager Container ID
input.help-text: Enter the Container ID you wish to enable for this site. You can find it on the "Manage Containers" page in Matomo Tag Manager
